issue.title: Extensibility for Teams AI - ability to add to User Agent for Teams AI telemetry

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: A request for new functionality or an enhancement to an existing one.

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: The issue has just been created and it has not been reviewed by the team.

issue.body:
Related to https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-js/issues/4552 

Request is from https://github.com/microsoft/teams-ai team

[ConnectorFactoryImpl](https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-dotnet/blob/617394d6ff834b0804cceabff2ed9d6e06342cd4/libraries/Microsoft.Bot.Connector/Authentication/ConnectorFactoryImpl.cs#L41)


We are hoping to have the ability to add Teams AI information for SMBA to parse for telemetry.

Since Teams AI is JavaScript first, we request this would be done in the JS SDK first with fast follow for C# and Python

comment.body:
This should probably be done as JS allows it, via ConfigurationBotFrameworkAuthentication. accepting a ConnectorClientOptions, on which a UserAgent value can be included.  This value is added on to our SDK UserAgent value.  For example: "TeamsAI/1.0" results in "botframework-connector/4.0.0 ms-rest-js/2.7.0 Node/v16.20.2 OS/(x64-Windows_NT-10.0.22621) TeamsAI/1.0".

There is no way to enforce this though.  That is, a customer could simply remove/change this in the bot.

Could also possible allow for the ConnectorClientOptions to read from Config, but it would need to be added to JS and Python.

release.body:
This is the October 2023 patch release for the Bot Framework DotNet SDK.

## What's Changed
* fix: [#6683] Timeout issue when using DLASE by @sw-joelmut in https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-dotnet/pull/6696
* Support SN+I authentication with AAD by @mikeus-hanzlik in https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-dotnet/pull/6694
* Add sendx5c parameter to Certificate factory class by @ceciliaavila in https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-dotnet/pull/6699
* [#6643] WithManagedIdentity is experimental and not exist in Microsoft.Identity.Client 4.51.0 by @sw-joelmut in https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-dotnet/pull/6686
* [#6651] Replace TestFramework package to remove ADAL dependencies by @ceciliaavila in https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-dotnet/pull/6690


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/microsoft/botbuilder-dotnet/compare/4.21.0...4.21.1

pull_request.title: Adding support for the SharePoint ACE APIs
pull_request.body:
## Description
SharePoint Framework is adding a new adaptive card experience (ACE) where it is powered by a Bot.  In order to be able to implement the bot we are updating the BotBuilder Framework to natively support these API's to make it easier for end users to add a bot powered ACE.

fixes #6613

## Specific Changes
We support 4 new BotInvoke activities:
            "cardExtension/getCardView"
            "cardExtension/getQuickView"
            "cardExtension/getPropertyPaneConfiguration"
            "cardExtension/setPropertyPaneConfiguration"

The SharePointActivityHandler in Microsoft.Bot.Builder.SharePoint is the base class for developing a bot powered ACE.  Users of this base class will need to implement the following 4 methods:

OnSharePointTaskGetCardViewAsync
OnSharePointTaskGetQuickViewAsync
OnSharePointTaskGetPropertyPaneConfigurationAsync
OnSharePointTaskSetPropertyPaneConfigurationAsync

## Testing
This was tested using a test app.  I will write unit tests in a further iteration of this PR.

commits.message:
Support SN+I authentication with AAD for CertificateServiceClientCredentialsFactory (#6694)

Co-authored-by: Michal Hanzlik <mihanzlk@microsoft.com>

pull_request.title: Support SN+I authentication with AAD
pull_request.body:
Fixes #6679

## Description
Support SN+I authentication with AAD for CertificateServiceClientCredentialsFactory. Fix of throttling issue caused by fetching a token from AAD for each request.

## Specific Changes
  - Added support for sendX5c flag in CertificateServiceClientCredentialsFactory.
  - Reused CertificateAppCredentials to fix throttling issue with AAD.

## Testing
Unit test added.
